Mr. Richard P. Vogl
- 2 -
November 6, 1957
I have noted during the past six years an increasing tendency for
the NAEB to become more and more a Midwestern social club for
radio operators. I had hoped (and worked) for the organization
to become a national center for leadership in education by broadÂ¬
casting. It has not, in my opinion, progressed. It has. In fact,
retrogressed. Its present status is much worse than it was when
Sy Siegel left its presidency.
Unless I can be convinced that the present reactionary tendencies
in NAEB leadership can be reversed promptly, I shall have to do
without NAEB. At present I will not regard this as a serious loss
to me or to KTCA-TV.
Very truly yours.
John C. Schwarzwalder
General Manager
oc: Dr. Burton Paulu
